edu.stanford.math.plex4.graph.random

Class ManifoldGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.graph.random.GraphInstanceGenerator
      • edu.stanford.math.plex4.graph.random.ManifoldGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    KNearestNeighborsGraph, SphereGraph, TorusGraph

    public abstract class ManifoldGraph
extends GraphInstanceGenerator
    This class is used to create a k-nearest neighbors graph on a manifold. It is abstract, and subclasses are required to implement the metric on the manifold.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ManifoldGraph

        protected ManifoldGraph(int size,
             int dimension,
             int k)
        Constructor for the ManifoldGraph class.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of points in the graph
        dimension - the dimension of the manifold
        k - the number of points to connect to

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public AbstractUndirectedGraph generate()
        Specified by:
        generate in class GraphInstanceGenerator

      • generateUniformPoints

        protected void generateUniformPoints()
        This function generates points on the d-dimensional cube [0, 1]^d. It is intended for manifolds represented by squares (or cubes) with their edges identified some way.

      • generatePoints

        protected abstract void generatePoints()
        This function must generate the set of random points on the manifold.

      • distance

        protected abstract double distance(double[] x,
              double[] y)
        This function must implement the distance function on the manifold.
        Parameters:
        x - the first point
        y - the second point
        Returns:
        the distance between x and y in the manifold

      • getNearestNeighbors

        protected int[] getNearestNeighbors(int index)
        This function gets the indices of the k nearest neighbors to the point at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the point
        Returns:
        the indices of the k nearest neighbors
